SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Screen.Pause

Class PauseScreen

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.Screen.Pause.PauseScreen
public class PauseScreen extends Object
The PauseScreen class provides functionality for managing the pause screen during the game. It handles the display of the pause screen and the actions associated with various buttons such as resume, levels, quit, and retry.

  • Constructor Details

    • PauseScreen

      public PauseScreen(double xPosition, double yPosition, double stageWidth, double stageHeight, LevelParent levelParent)
      Constructor for initializing the PauseScreen.
      Parameters:
      xPosition - Horizontal position of the pause screen container
      yPosition - Vertical position of the pause screen container
      stageWidth - Width of the game stage
      stageHeight - Height of the game stage
      levelParent - The parent level object to control game state (pause, resume)

  • Method Details

    • initializeContainer

      private void initializeContainer(double stageWidth, double stageHeight)
      Initializes the container and adds the pause button to the UI.
      Parameters:
      stageWidth - The width of the game stage
      stageHeight - The height of the game stage

    • createPauseButton

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView createPauseButton(double stageWidth, double stageHeight)
      Creates the pause button with dynamic size and position based on the stage dimensions.
      Parameters:
      stageWidth - The width of the game stage
      stageHeight - The height of the game stage
      Returns:
      The ImageView representing the pause button

    • showPauseScreen

      private void showPauseScreen(javafx.scene.image.ImageView pauseButton)
      Displays the pause screen with overlay, including buttons for resume, levels, quit, and retry.
      Parameters:
      pauseButton - The pause button that was clicked
